title: Ariana Grande features on five songs on Charlie's Angels soundtrack
text:
Ariana is taking over (Picture: Getty)

Ariana Grande fans are in for a treat now it’s been confirmed that their fave will be on four new songs as part of the Charlie’s Angels soundtrack.

Ari’s dominance in song features should come as no surprise seeing as the singer was in charge of putting the project together as the latest reboot of the iconic show makes its way to the big screen.

We’ve already heard Don’t Call Me Angel (Charlie’s Angels) which sees Ariana team up with Miley Cyrus and Lana Del Rey for a sassy, feel-good bop.

But after the 26-year-old unveiled the full track list online on Friday, it became clear that there is a whole lot more Ari goodness to come.

She has solo track, How I Look On You, as well as a duet with her good friend Victoria Monét called Got Her Own.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Then fans will get to her Ari’s vocals alongside the one and only Chaka Khan on the track, Nobody.

But the song that’s really got the fans excited is the collaboration between Ariana, Nicki Minaj and Normani titled Bad To You.

‘Who decided that we as humans were ready for a song containing ariana, normani, AND nicki??? WHO?’ one fan tweeted.

‘ARIANA, NORMANI, AND NICKI ALL ON ONE F**KING TRACK MY EARS ARE NOT READY,’ another wrote.

Kristen Stewart, Naomi Scott and Ella Belinska are set to kick ass in the upcoming film by Elizabeth Banks, which is out in cinemas on Friday 15 November.

description: Ariana Grande features on five songs for the new Charlie’s Angels soundtrack and fans are delighted by the news.
